intro: Rhodosciadium argutum, commonly known as the rough rhodesior, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its robust, branched stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, stiff hairs, which give it a rugged appearance. Rhodosciadium argutum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
